Class Proj4

  • java.lang.Object
    • Proj4

  • public class Proj4
extends java.lang.Object
    Project 4: Web Page Preprocessing This program takes a list of one or more URLS from its command line. For each such URL, this program does the following:
    1. Creates a directory.
    2. Downloads the resource associated with said URL into its directory
    3. If said resource is an HTML file, the program downloads all resources (such as image, audio files, videos) that are necessary to construct a web page.

                          throws java.io.IOException

        Parameters:

      • saveResource

        public static byte[] saveResource(java.io.File dir,
                                  java.lang.String urlString,
                                  java.lang.String argURLString)
                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                  java.net.URISyntaxException
        Save a resource in a file, as well as in a byte array. The latter is the return value.
        Parameters:
        dir - the directory in which the resources will be saved
        urlString - the resource's url, either relative or absolute
        argURLString - if not empty, then the urlString was found on the website by argURLString.
        Returns:
        If something goes wrong with the file creation.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.net.URISyntaxException

      • getSourceUrls

        public static java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> getSourceUrls(byte[] data)
        Get all the src (or SRC) URLs that appear in an array of bytes. For the purpose of this project, we will only look for occurrences of src="stuff" or of SRC="stuff", where stuff is a URL.
        Parameters:
        data - a sequence of chars that might contain src(or SRC) URLS, initialized from the contents of a URL.
        Returns:
        a Vector containing all the src(or SRC) attributes found in data.

      • makeAbsoluteURL

        public static java.net.URL makeAbsoluteURL(java.lang.String s,
                                           java.lang.String argURLString)
                                    throws java.net.URISyntaxException,
                                           java.net.MalformedURLException
        Make the absolute version of a relative URL.
        Parameters:
        s - a relative URL
        argURLString - the URL of the web page on which s was found.
        Returns:
        an absolute URL that resolves s and argURLString.
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException
        java.net.MalformedURLException

      • makeSrcName

        public static java.lang.String makeSrcName(java.lang.String s)
        Case-sensitive version of indexOf().
        Parameters:
        s - string to search for "src="
        Returns:
        string of index of s substring or "" if "src=" not found
